question.title: How to update a single field of an entity using PUT in Spring Boot?
question.body:
I know how to use the HTTP PUT method to update an entire entity, but how to update a single field for an example? I gonna need a lot of if's?

My method for updating the data in a Service:

public ProfessionalUser uptadeProfessionalData(Long professionalId,  ProfessionalRequestDto professionalDto) {
    ProfessionalUser professionalUser = professionalRepository.findById(professionalId)
        .orElseThrow(() -> new ResourceNotFoundException("User not found!"));
    ProfessionalUser updatedProfessional = modelMapper.map(professionalDto, ProfessionalUser.class);

    return professionalRepository.save(updatedProfessional);
}
